item.title: Crypto ETPs Face Massive $2.9B Outflow Amid Market Uncertainty
item.description: The largest weekly sell-off ever occurred last week for cryptocurrency exchange-traded products (ETPs), with outflows hitting a record $2.9 billion. According to CoinShares, a European crypto investment business, $3.8 billion has been wiped out in worldwide crypto ETPs due to three weeks of outflows running concurrently. item.title: Confusion Reigns as Russia CBDC Launch Is ‘Delayed Indefinitely’
item.description:
The rollout of Russia’s CBDC, the digital ruble, has been delayed “indefinitely,” media reports have claimed. And some have suggested Moscow’s recent crypto pivot may be behind the Central Bank’s sudden decision.

The post Confusion Reigns as Russia CBDC Launch Is ‘Delayed Indefinitely’ appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: SEC Agrees in Principle to Drop Lawsuit Against Kraken
item.description:
The SEC has agreed to dismiss its lawsuit against Kraken with prejudice, meaning no penalties or business changes for the exchange, marking a significant development in U.S. crypto regulation.

The post SEC Agrees in Principle to Drop Lawsuit Against Kraken appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Ray Dalio Believes Bitcoin Could Play a Big Role in Wealth Protection
item.description:
Ray Dalio warned that the U.S. faces a potential debt crisis within three years if deficits remain unchecked. He suggested that investors may turn to Bitcoin and gold as alternative stores of value. Dalio emphasized the risk of declining confidence in U.S. Treasuries and urged policymakers to take immediate action.

The post Ray Dalio Believes Bitcoin Could Play a Big Role in Wealth Protection appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Congressional Crypto Caucus Launched as U.S. Eyes Digital Future
item.description:
The Crypto Caucus, co-chaired by Rep. Tom Emmer and Rep. Ritchie Torres, seeks to establish a bipartisan approach to U.S. digital asset regulation, addressing blockchain’s role in finance and innovation as federal policies take shape.

The post Congressional Crypto Caucus Launched as U.S. Eyes Digital Future appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Trump’s Crypto Reserve Sends Cardano Soaring 70% – Is ADA Heading for $100?
item.description:
Cardano (ADA) saw a massive more than 70% surge on Sunday in wake of US President Donald Trump announcing that he has ordered the creation of a US crypto reserve that would include Cardano, alongside Solana, XRP, Bitcoin, Ethereum and other major cryptos.

The post Trump’s Crypto Reserve Sends Cardano Soaring 70% – Is ADA Heading for $100? appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Coinbase Seeks SEC’s Spending on Crypto Industry Investigations Under Gary Gensler
item.description:
Coinbase has filed a FOIA request seeking transparency on the SEC’s spending on crypto enforcement over the past four years, aiming to assess the financial and regulatory impact of its actions.

The post Coinbase Seeks SEC’s Spending on Crypto Industry Investigations Under Gary Gensler appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: U.S. Senate to Vote on IRS Broker Rule This Week: Report
item.description:
The U.S. Senate is reviewing an IRS rule that categorizes DeFi operators as brokers, raising concerns over its impact on blockchain innovation and tax compliance. A potential reversal could redefine crypto regulations and shape the broader landscape for digital assets in the U.S.

The post U.S. Senate to Vote on IRS Broker Rule This Week: Report appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Ethereum Price Crashes 13% Despite Trump Crypto Reserve Announcement – Why?
item.description:
The Ethereum (ETH) price has crashed back below $2,200 to levels that are actually below those before US President Donald Trump’s strategic crypto reserve announcement, that he said would include Ethereum.

The post Ethereum Price Crashes 13% Despite Trump Crypto Reserve Announcement – Why? appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) on Monday added five security flaws impacting software from Cisco, Hitachi Vantara, Microsoft Windows, and Progress WhatsUp Gold to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, based on evidence of active exploitation.
The list of vulnerabilities is as follows -

item.description:
Google has released its monthly Android Security Bulletin for March 2025 to address a total of 44 vulnerabilities, including two that it said have come under active exploitation in the wild.
The two high-severity vulnerabilities are listed below -
